content: I encountered an issue where simp solved my entire goal inside conv, and I wanted to see what it did - when I ran simp?, I noticed that the tactic didn't exist, so I wanted to PR it. However, I wanted to ask before I do so if there's any reason that it wasn't implemented.
It was just implemented two weeks ago, and it'll be in the next release :-) lean4#6593
Tristan Figueroa-Reid has marked this topic as resolved.

(That being said, for the future -- you can run any tactic in conv mode by prefacing with tactic =>. No guarantees that it will do what you expect -- conv mode will run it on $term = ?m, and can't really handle it if the tactic does much to the structure of that goal -- but it's nice for using minor variants like simp?.)
